陳.definition: (bound form) to lay out; to exhibit; to display; (bound form) to narrate; to state; to explain; to tell; old; stale

陳仁錫.definition: Chen Renxi (1581-1636), late Ming scholar and prolific author

陳仲琳.definition: Chen Zhonglin, aka Xu Zhonglin 許仲琳|许仲琳[Xu3 Zhong4lin2] (c. 1567-c. 1620), Ming novelist, to whom the fantasy novel Investiture of the Gods 封神演義|封神演义[Feng1shen2 Yan3yi4] is attributed, together with Lu Xixing 陸西星|陆西星[Lu4 Xi1xing1]

陳伯達.definition: Chen Boda (1904-1989), communist party theorist, interpreter of Maoism

陳倉.definition: ancient name of Baoji City 寶雞市|宝鸡市[Bao3 ji1 Shi4], Shaanxi; Chencang district of Baoji City

陳倉區.definition: Chencang District of Baoji City 寶雞市|宝鸡市[Bao3 ji1 Shi4], Shaanxi

陳元光.definition: Chen Yuanguang (657-711), Tang dynasty general with posthumous title 開漳聖王|开漳圣王[Kai1 zhang1 sheng4 wang2], i.e. Sacred King, founder of Zhangzhou 漳州[Zhang1 zhou1], Fujian

陳兵.definition: to deploy troops; to mass troops

陳其邁.definition: Chen Chi-mai (1964-), Taiwanese DPP politician, vice premier of the Republic of China (2019-)

陳再道.definition: Chen Zaidao (1909-1993), general in the People's Liberation Army

陳冠希.definition: Edison Chen (1980-), Hong Kong singer and actor

陳勝.definition: Chen Sheng (died 208 BC), Qin dynasty rebel, leader of the Chen Sheng Wu Guang Uprising 陳勝吳廣起義|陈胜吴广起义[Chen2 Sheng4 Wu2 Guang3 Qi3 yi4]

陳勝吳廣起義.pinyin: chén shèng wú guǎng qǐ yì
陳勝吳廣起義.definition: Chen Sheng Wu Guang Uprising (209 BC), near the end of the Qin dynasty

陳化.definition: to age; to mature (wine, timber etc)

陳壽.definition: Chen Shou (233-297), Western Jin dynasty 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] historian, author of History of the Three Kingdoms 三國志|三国志[San1 guo2 zhi4]

陳天華.definition: Chen Tianhua (1875-1905), anti-Qing revolutionary from Hunan, drowned himself in Japan in 1905

陳奏.definition: to present a memorial (to the Emperor)

陳奕迅.definition: Eason Chan (1974-), Hong Kong pop singer and actor

陳嬌.definition: Chen Jiao, first wife of emperor 漢武帝|汉武帝[Han4 Wu3 di4], died c. 110 BC

陳巴爾虎旗.definition: Old Barag banner in Hulunbuir 呼倫貝爾|呼伦贝尔[Hu1 lun2 bei4 er3], Inner Mongolia

陳希同.definition: Chen Xitong (1930-2013), mayor of Beijing at the time of 4th June 1989 Tiananmen incident

陳年.definition: (of wine) aged; (of debts etc) old; longstanding

陳建仁.definition: Chen Chien-jen (1951-), Taiwanese politician, vice president of the Republic of China 2016-2020

陳德良.definition: Tran Duc Luong (1937-), former president of Vietnam

陳忱.definition: Chen Chen (1613-1670), novelist and poet at the Ming-Qing transition, author of Water Margin sequel 水滸後傳|水浒后传

陳恭尹.definition: Chen Gongyin (1631-1700), early Qing dynasty poet

陳摶.definition: Chen Tuan (871-989), a legendary Daoist sage

陳方安生.definition: Anson Chan (1940-), chief secretary for administration, Hong Kong (1997-2001)

陳書.definition: History of Chen of the Southern Dynasties, ninth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Yao Silian 姚思廉[Yao2 Si1 lian2] in 636 during Tang dynasty, 36 scrolls

陳橋兵變.definition: the military revolt of 960 that led Zhao Kuangyin 趙匡胤|赵匡胤 to found the Song dynasty

陳毅.definition: Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972

陳水扁.definition: Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008

陳沖.definition: Joan Chen (1961-), Chinese born American actress

陳炯明.definition: Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong

陳獨秀.definition: Chen Duxiu (1879-1942), co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1921

陳皮.definition: dried tangerine peel (used in cuisine and traditional Chinese medicine)

陳米.definition: old rice; rice kept for many years

陳納德.definition: (Claire) Chennault, commander of Flying Tigers during World War II

陳美.definition: Vanessa-Mae (1978-), Singaporean-born British violinist and skier

陳腐.definition: trite; clichéd; empty and trite; banality; platitude

陳設.definition: to display; to set out; furnishings

陳詞.definition: to state one's views; speech; statement; plea

陳谷子爛芝麻.pinyin: chén gǔ zi làn zhī má
陳谷子爛芝麻.definition: lit. stale grain, overcooked sesame (idiom); fig. the same boring old gossip

陳跡.definition: past events; relics from a former age; ruins

陳述.definition: an assertion; to declare; to state

陳述書.definition: representation letter (law); a brief; written statement; declaration

陳雲.definition: Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist

陳雲林.definition: Chen Yunlin (1941-), chairman of PRC Association for Relations Across the Taiwan Straits (ARATS) 海峽兩岸關係協會|海峡两岸关系协会[Hai3 xia2 Liang3 an4 Guan1 xi5 Xie2 hui4] (2008-2013)

陳露.definition: Lu Chen (1976-), PRC figure skater, 1995 world champion

陳香梅.definition: Chen Xiangmei (1925-2018), a.k.a. Anna Chennault, born in Beijing, US Republican Party politician, wife of Claire Lee Chennault 陳納德|陈纳德[Chen2 na4 de2]
